content: This chapter defines citizenship and explores the rights and responsibilities of citizens in a democratic society.
This chapter introduces the Canadian Constitution, including the Charter of Rights and Freedoms.
This chapter explores the structure and function of the Canadian government, including the three branches of government: the executive, legislative, and judicial.
This chapter examines the electoral process in Canada, including the right to vote, political parties, and the role of citizens in elections.
This chapter explores different ways citizens can participate in their communities and make a difference.
